definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to express/to give expression to/variant of 紓|纾[shu1]/to relieve

sentences.english: Shakespeare' s sonnets are the only direct expression of the poet' s own feelings.
sentences.chinese: 這些十四行詩都是莎翁直抒胸臆的成果。

sentences.english: Pouring out the heart is exactly the writing style of this writer.
sentences.chinese: 這種直抒胸臆的寫法正是這位作家的風格。

sentences.english: Americans talk like their poems, as soon as possible into the topic, won't beat around the bush.
sentences.chinese: 美國人說話喜歡直抒胸臆，儘快入題，不會拐彎抹角。

sentences.english: When was the last time you had a gut feeling about someone?
sentences.chinese: 最後一次是什麼時候當你敢直抒胸臆？

sentences.english: Shakespeare's sonnets are the only direct expression_r of the poet's own feelings.
sentences.chinese: 這些十四行詩都是莎翁直抒胸臆的成果。

definition: to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
falsification in writing/misrepresentation in written history/deliberate digression
to say straight out/to point out bluntly/to give a straightforward account/to disclose
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
to borrow the past as a model for the present
